alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 02 at 12:58PM MST until March 03 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. From noon Thursday to Friday afternoon, Additional snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches in the mountains, including Lookout Pass. Additional accumulations up to 3 inches in the valleys. Ridgetop winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Dobson Pass, Pinehurst, Fourth Of July Pass, St. Maries, Wallace, Mullan, Lookout Pass, Kellogg, Osburn, and Fernwood. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...This afternoon, temperatures climbing into the 30s will limit snow accumulation efficiency in the valleys. However, travel across Lookout Pass will continue to be impacted by snow through Friday, especially in the overnight and morning hours.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
